div.div: build genesis state if one wasn't read from disk

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 148px; height: 1px; padding-top: 302px; margin-left: 8px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: The SwirldMain is constructed here so that it has a chance to register configuration types.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 198px; height: 1px; padding-top: 862px; margin-left: 473px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: This will call into application code when the state is deserialized (the SwirldState object and merkle node children)

switch.text: This will call into application c...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 148px; height: 1px; padding-top: 862px; margin-left: 8px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: Needs to happen after we have all of the platform context utilities constructed.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 178px; height: 1px; padding-top: 652px; margin-left: 513px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: No particular reason why this has to happen here, as long as it happens somewhere in startup sequence.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 148px; height: 1px; padding-top: 512px; margin-left: 543px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: Configuration is the first utility we set up since other utilities depend on configuration values.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 183px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1061px; margin-left: 603px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Must happen after state is loaded from disk, but before we construct the platform and call the init() methods. This is because both the platform and the application use the address book to set up data structures, and it is easier to modify the address book before these things have been constructed.
This workflow wont be used after we transition to transaction driven address book changes.

switch.text: Must happen after state is l...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 148px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1494px; margin-left: 583px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: This takes a reference to the platform, so this needs to happen after the platform has been constructed.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 148px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1579px; margin-left: 583px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: Also takes a reference to the platform and needs to be called after the platform is constructed.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 148px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1774px; margin-left: 583px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: The application may be asked to apply transactions to the state.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 148px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1861px; margin-left: 583px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: New application transactions will reach consensus and need to be handled by the app.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 148px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1984px; margin-left: 583px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: No strong reason why this happens here, just needs to happen at some point in time during startup.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 178px; height: 1px; padding-top: 92px; margin-left: 363px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: Container used in production environments but not strictly necessary from a technical point of view

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 153px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1447px; margin-left: 377px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;

a.text: Text is not SVG - cannot display
